basics.name: David J. Davis
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: I am a full stack developer that can not only design the application, but also produce highly effective functional applications. Higher education has helped me to hone my graphic design skills, programming skills, and taught me how to be life time learner.  At West Virginia University Libraries, I got the opportunity to take Gallup Strengths Finder Quiz, which allows you to get an un-bias idea of what skills you can bring to the table as a form of self-reflection.  My skills where communication, consistency, learner, achiever, and adaptability.  I believe that each of these skills is extremely useful in development.  Being able to learn and adapt to new technologies is often critical in my day-to-day work.  Communicating effectively with clients allows me to get a better idea of what they are looking for and help them achieve the goals of the application.   Consistency is needed day in and day out to stay on top of bugs, security, and trends in the industry. I am a full stack developer, and I love what I do!

work.summary: Lead a team of developers in programming specialized applications associated with the Libraries network facilities and web pages. highlights: Accomplished removing accessibility errors (A, AA, AAA) from WVU Libraries various websites and applications using HTML, JavaScript, PHP, and Ruby.
Implemented Docker to upgrade the digital repository software which relies on writing scripts in PHP, Ruby (Hydra), and having an understanding of Blacklight, Solr, and Fedora Commons.

Upgrading PHP applications that were written in a proprietary framework to a more public framework such as Laravel, Rails, or other based on needs of the project.  The intent was to gain more traction for our open source applications.

Established developer guidelines for use in our applications often adopting main stream styleguides. Wrote documentation, training plans, development processes, and production processes for the small team at the Libraries.
Integrated Tools for Automated Code Reviews and Quality Assurance.

Other common tasks include debugging applications, cleaning and manipulating data through writing command line scripts, and finding ways to automate scripts that have been manually updated via the command line.

publications.name: Full-Stack JavaScript Frameworks: Using Frameworks to Supplement Programming Concepts in Graphic Design Curricula
publications.publisher: Savannah, Georgia: Savannah College of Art and Design (eLearning)
publications.summary: This thesis examines the designers’ role in the web industry, focusing on two major parts. The first is to inform and teach designers the value and benefits of programming by means of creating web applications. The second acts as a catalyst to quickly engage the students using frameworks, visual learning, and learn-by-doing methodologies. The goal of the study is to further design curricula by finding a productive way to introduce programming concepts in a way that empowers the student.

references.name: Tim Broadwater
references.reference: David is a fantastic coworker and vital member of our development team. He always lends a hand with any type of debugging issue, he stays current with industry development languages and standards, and he is professional and courteous in the workplace. Both a creative web application developer and JavaScript wizard, Dave would be a great addition to any software team.

references.name: David Meyers
references.reference: As a full-time professor for the Savannah College of Art and Design, I have had the pleasure of knowing and instructing David Davis for the last three years. I would like to take this opportunity to recommend David as a candidate for employment at your institution I feel confident that he will succeed as an instructor at every level. David has been a dedicated student whose effort and grades have been excellent in the area of Interactive Design and Game Development. He has shown particular strengths in adapting complex programming frameworks at entry-level students. He possesses a gift of making complex items simple - an asset for anyone pursuing a career in education. David has exhibited tremendous technical aptitude, initiative and fortitude in completing his master’s thesis. It is for these reasons that I offer high recommendations for David without reservation. His drive and abilities will truly be an asset to your institution. If you have any questions regarding this recommendation, please do not hesitate to contact me.

references.name: Ajay Kavuri
references.reference: 'A great mentor' is the phrase that comes to my mind when I think about Dave. Dave and I have worked together on several projects at WVU Libraries Systems department. He is always willing to brainstorm ideas, share knowledge and provides valuable feedback. He insists on software best practices such as unit testing, code reviews, and documentation. He introduced continuous integration testing that saved both time and effort for developers in our team. All this added with his passion for building user-friendly applications will make him an asset to any team.
